newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian govt shakes up giant UES electricity firm.
newsitem.headline: Russian govt shakes up giant UES electricity firm.

text.p: The government, restructuring Russia's largest firm, will replace Unified Energy System (UES) Chief Executive Anatoly Dyakov with UES Vice-President Boris Brevnov, a senior cabinet official said on Friday.

First Deputy Prime Minister Boris Nemtsov, who announced the changes at a news conference and who is in charge of reforming natural monopolies, said Dyakov would remain board chairman at the electricity company. Nemtsov also said UES was now effectively under state control and that he would head a government committee to oversee state interests in the company.
